body:
NEED URGENT HELP

1. I downloaded Tails, verified it, and flashed it to a USB. 

2. I booted on my macbook, after booting screen, it brought me to a blank page with a list of commands when it should have brought up the interface

3. attempted to exit but now my screen is covered in mumbo jumbo and my computer wont turn off and I cant exit

4. I accidently knocked the USB out of my computer after so maybe that made it freeze


Should I just let the power die and reboot the normal macintosh way, Or do I need some serious help?

also what did I do wrong? the download was perfectly verified
body_html:
NEED URGENT HELP

  1. I downloaded Tails, verified it, and flashed it to a USB.

  2. I booted on my macbook, after booting screen, it brought me to a blank page with a list of commands when it should have brought up the interface

  3. attempted to exit but now my screen is covered in mumbo jumbo and my computer wont turn off and I cant exit

  4. I accidently knocked the USB out of my computer after so maybe that made it freeze

Should I just let the power die and reboot the normal macintosh way, Or do I need some serious help?

also what did I do wrong? the download was perfectly verified
title: NEED URGENT HELP,  SOMETHING WENT VERY WRONG

body: I think what you mean is it brought you to the grub boot menu, thats normal. As for why it got fucked up its probably due to it like what you said when you knocked it out
body_html: I think what you mean is it brought you to the grub boot menu, thats normal. As for why it got fucked up its probably due to it like what you said when you knocked it out

author.bio_html:

"And you will surely hear from those who were given the Scripture before you, and from the polytheists, much abuse. But if you are patient and fear Allah - indeed, that is of the matters [worthy] of determination."

body: idk what you did but your mac's hard drive is most likely fine. If it just absolutely won't turn off, just wait for the battery to die and then plug it back in. Tails just runs in RAM so nothing in your actual hard drive should've been affected. And yes, when you're running a Live OS from a USB and then the USB disconnects, it will freeze the OS.
body_html: idk what you did but your mac's hard drive is most likely fine. If it just absolutely won't turn off, just wait for the battery to die and then plug it back in. Tails just runs in RAM so nothing in your actual hard drive should've been affected. And yes, when you're running a Live OS from a USB and then the USB disconnects, it will freeze the OS.

body: I would guess that Mac's BIOS probably doesn't like loading/running anything that isn't Mac OS, but I've never owned a MacBook and I've heard of people installing Linux on their MacBooks before so /shrug. See if you can boot into a live iso of another distro like Ubuntu or something and see what happens

parent.body: No it's not normal, it could be caused by many things, usb not flashed correctly, incorrect architecture, etc. Idk if tails has a community forum but I'd recommend trying to post there with a screen cap of the problem
parent.body_html: No it's not normal, it could be caused by many things, usb not flashed correctly, incorrect architecture, etc. Idk if tails has a community forum but I'd recommend trying to post there with a screen cap of the problem

post.body:
NEED URGENT HELP

1. I downloaded Tails, verified it, and flashed it to a USB. 

2. I booted on my macbook, after booting screen, it brought me to a blank page with a list of commands when it should have brought up the interface

3. attempted to exit but now my screen is covered in mumbo jumbo and my computer wont turn off and I cant exit

4. I accidently knocked the USB out of my computer after so maybe that made it freeze


Should I just let the power die and reboot the normal macintosh way, Or do I need some serious help?

also what did I do wrong? the download was perfectly verified
post.body_html:
NEED URGENT HELP

  1. I downloaded Tails, verified it, and flashed it to a USB.

  2. I booted on my macbook, after booting screen, it brought me to a blank page with a list of commands when it should have brought up the interface

  3. attempted to exit but now my screen is covered in mumbo jumbo and my computer wont turn off and I cant exit

  4. I accidently knocked the USB out of my computer after so maybe that made it freeze

Should I just let the power die and reboot the normal macintosh way, Or do I need some serious help?

also what did I do wrong? the download was perfectly verified
post.title: NEED URGENT HELP,  SOMETHING WENT VERY WRONG

body:
Normally with tails it will wipe memory first before shutting off if you pulled the usb stick, assuming it finished booting.(Which is a good thing)

Otherwise try holding the power button to force shutdown the computer.
body_html:
Normally with tails it will wipe memory first before shutting off if you pulled the usb stick, assuming it finished booting.(Which is a good thing)

Otherwise try holding the power button to force shutdown the computer.

parent.body: I would guess that Mac's BIOS probably doesn't like loading/running anything that isn't Mac OS, but I've never owned a MacBook and I've heard of people installing Linux on their MacBooks before so /shrug. See if you can boot into a live iso of another distro like Ubuntu or something and see what happens
parent.body_html: I would guess that Mac's BIOS probably doesn't like loading/running anything that isn't Mac OS, but I've never owned a MacBook and I've heard of people installing Linux on their MacBooks before so /shrug. See if you can boot into a live iso of another distro like Ubuntu or something and see what happens
